engine_life_check_timeout (by default, 2s). But unlike other messages sent
using that timeout, stop_stack needs to synchronously kill all running
threads operating on the stack. For a very large stack, this can easily
take much longer than a couple of seconds. This patch increases the timeout
to give a better chance of being able to start the delete.

subject: Try to reuse existing IPs when a port update specifies subnet
commit_message:
Try to reuse existing IPs when a port update specifies subnet

If a port update specifies only a subnet_id for a fixed_ip then we
want to look at existing fixed_ips to see if that subnet_id is already
there. This avoids allocating a new IP address on the subnet and
deallocating the old one.

Without some special care, this breaks the code path for prefix
delegation. One could argue that PD needs reworking. However, as a
stop-gap measure, we still run the old code path if the address is an
EUI-64 address. This allows PD to continue to work as it was
originally written and it doesn't do any harm because allocating
EUI-64 addresses is repeatable.

This commit removes a test case from the DNS integration tests. The
test was specifically testing that DNS records we updated in the case
where a subnet id was passed to re-allocate a fixed_ip. Since the use
case no longer works, the test doesn't make sense.

This commit also preserves the ability to add an additional IP from a
subnet for which the port already has IPs.

interface and extensibility (see [1] for more details). Our end
goal here is removing the retrying package from our requirements.

Tenacity provides the same functionality as retrying, but has the
following major differences to account for:
- tenacity uses seconds rather than ms as retrying did.
- tenacity has different kwargs for the decorator and
Retrying class itself.
- tenacity has a different approach for retrying args by
using classes for its stop/wait/retry kwargs.
- By default tenacity raises a RetryError if a retried callable
times out; retrying raises the last exception from the callable.
Tenacity provides backwards compatibility here by offering
the 'reraise' kwarg.
- tenacity defines 'time.sleep' as a default value for a kwarg.
That said consumers who need to mock patch time.sleep
need to account for this via mocking of time.sleep before
tenacity is imported.

This patch updates all usages of retrying with tenacity.
Unit tests will be added where applicable.

Note: This change is not newton critical so projects are welcome
to hold off on committing until post-newton. Ideally this change
will merge by the first part of Ocata so dependant functionality
can land and have time to solidify for Ocata.

[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

subject: Add to rally quotas to handle worst case quota race
commit_message:
Add to rally quotas to handle worst case quota race

Quoting the quota devref:
"""
For a reservation to be successful, the total amount of resources requested,
plus the total amount of resources reserved, plus the total amount of resources
already stored in the database should not exceed the project's quota limit.
"""

This means that in the absolute worst case scenario with 20 concurrent
workers, 19 could have made reservations, committed resources, but not
yet cleared their reservation. Because of the outstanding reservation
and the resources created by the 19 workers, they will all be
double-counted until their reservation is cleared (or it expires).

subject: driver interface: introduce precommit, postcommit
commit_message:
driver interface: introduce precommit, postcommit

This patch introduces precommit, postcommit method to driver interface.
This is required by ODL support.
It requires a method which is called during db transaction and a method
which is called after db transaction.
- This patch introduces new hook, <op>_<resource>_pre/postcommit
  precommit is called within the same db transaction of neutron resource
  postcommit is called after db transaction
- create/update_<resource> are renamed to
  create/update_<resoruce>_postcommit

In order to keep the compatibility of the existing drivers
- introduce new class, XXXBaseLegacy, which defines deprecated method
  <create/update>_<resource>
  By default, those method will be called by XXXBase class as default
  implementation.
- driver base class implements new methods
  <create/update/delete>_<resource>_<precommit/postcommit>
  methods as nop as non-abstract method
  create/update_<resource>_postcommit call create/update_<resource>
  by default
- delete_<resource> are kept because it is called before db transaction

networking-odl requires a method that is called during db transaction
that acts on neutron resource.
networking-odl driver doesn't directly send request to ODL SDN
controller on behalf of resource operation
(create/update/delete_xxx method). But it creates operation log entry
in db table, and then background thread replays operation logs by
actually sending request to the ODL. It's essential that operation log
is created under same db transaction of operating neutron resource in
order to avoid inconsistency.
Potentially other sfc drivers like ovs-agent, ovn may have similar
issue and would take advantage of this change.

The details can be found at [1]
[1] https://wiki.opendaylight.org/view/NeutronNorthbound:NeutronDriverOverhaul

commit_message:
Change the logic of selecting image for tests

Right now devstack sets DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME depending on the driver in
stackrc. UUID of the image with this name is then written to tempest
config during tempest configuration stage and is used to determine
which image will be used during nova boot.

As ironic python agent now supports both whole disk and partition

request which image should be used in tests.

This commit adds IRONIC_TEMPEST_WHOLE_DISK_IMAGE and
IRONIC_IMAGE_NAME variables to provide this possibility.

If IRONIC_TEMPEST_WHOLE_DISK_IMAGE is not set, we try to infer the
image type by the size of the ephemeral partition requested, if it
is 0, we consider the image to be whole disk.

Change query for port-pair-group and port-chain id. Fix bug 1625186.

Bug: When two non admin users in two different tenants/projects create
port-chain-group or port-chain, the first user would succeed, but the
second user did later would get an internal error, and creation failed.

Cause: The error was rooted at the query to retrieve port-pair-groups and

has to be unique, and go by sequence from 1. New id was calculated by
the total current rows of groups and chains plus 1. This would cause id lose
uniqueness, and new group and chain creation failed.

Fix: This change will make the query to retrieve all rows in the table
regardless of tenant/project.

the attachment field when calling the volume-update swap operation where
the value is now the previous volume ID instead of the current volume
ID. It litterally makes it now imposible to detech the volume from the
instance once it has been swapped (even after the first swap).

attaching the volume before swapping back to the original volume, and
because the original bug only impacts an admin API while here it impacts
a user API, it's preferrable to directly revert the regression and then
work on the next cycle about the root problem rather than leaving the
change and try to fix something which is hard to troubleshoot, also
given the lack of functional tests around the volume operations.

This reverts commit be553fb15591c6fc212ef3a07c1dd1cbc43d6866.

subject: CLI rework.
commit_message:
CLI rework.

This Patch Set reworks the cli. For now, instead of replacing the
'kolla-kubernetes' tool it makes a new tool called 'kollakube'.
This new command requires less typing. Operators who will need to
type the command a lot, so shortening the cli will help over time.
In a future PS the old 'kolla-kubernetes' command will be removed.

It reworks the resource and template system to allow the operator
to specify multiple entries to be processed at once. This aligns
kollakube with kubectl behavior.

The 'resource-template' subcommand is renamed to just 'template'.

The 'resource-map' subcommand is renamed to just 'map'.

The 'template' subcommand drops the action argument as it has no
effect.

Aliases are added from 'resource' to 'res' and 'template' to 'tmpl'.

The 'kollakube' cli removes any workflow related subcommands as they
are unlikely to work well moving forward and will be replaced
shortly with an ansible workflow.

Bump 'global-requirements' for 'oslo.concurrency' to 2.6.1

In this[1] change, when it was initially proposed to update
'global-requirements', but we ended up only updating the
'upper-constraints.txt', because of concerns that bumping
'oslo.concurrency' also bumped related components: 'pbr', 'oslo.config'
and 'oslo.utils'.

Another argument went:

    "We do not generally raise the minimum version of dependencies to
    fix bugs, and we especially don't want to do that in stable
    branches. Please update this to only changes the
    upper-constraints.txt file."

However, these above arguments are questioned in this Nova backport[2],
where we try to handle the case of deployments not having new
enough oslo.concurrency.

All of this to get a fix for CVE-2015-5162 -- "qemu-img calls need to be
restricted by ulimit"

subject: Do not attempt deletion of a DELETE_COMPLETE stack in service api
commit_message:
Do not attempt deletion of a DELETE_COMPLETE stack in service api

A stack may be in transient state where it is DELETE_COMPLETE, but has
has not actually been soft-deleted yet. For the purposes of
delete_stack in service.py, consider a DELETE_COMPLETE stack as
equivalent to a soft-deleted one (it soon will be), thereby avoiding a
race where we would have attempted to update the stack, running into a
foreign-key constraint issue for a non-existing user_cred.

subject: Update port provisioning block registration
commit_message:
Update port provisioning block registration

Deployments with the neutron DHCP agent must ensure that port status
is not changed to ACTIVE until OVN finishes provisioning the port.
This is done by adding provisioning blocks when a port is created
and when OVN marks the port down. The later provisioning block is
currently missing. Without the block, the neutron DHCP agent may
change the port status to ACTIVE before OVN is ready. In addition,
the provisioning block added during port creation should be done
during the ML2 precommit stage to avoid a similar problem.

Missing provisioning blocks creates a couple problems. The first
and easiest to notice problem is that shutting down an instance
keeps the port status ACTIVE when it should be DOWN. The second
and much more difficult problem is a timing window which is
generated during instance actions. The timing window can prevent
neutron from generating a network-vif-plugged event when nova
expects one. The event isn't generated because networking-ovn
didn't add a provisioning block to prevent the neutron DHCP
agent from interferring with VIF plugging.

Change-Id: I8355c94dbafaf7bc3f12871b7127db0087b67761
Closes-Bug: 1624120
(cherry picked from commit 4ae6b676236e568ba31dcc602c6f6b3165b60481)

subject: Improve test_delete_saving_image
commit_message:
Improve test_delete_saving_image

Currently, in test_delete_saving_image we will wait
until the image status changed to "Saving" state;
For testing using very small image(which will be a
common case for doing defcore tests) in an high
performance platorms, for example, the backend
for compute node and glance backend is the same
shared storage, the "saving" process could be
really fast, and the current minimal
client.build_interval is limited to 1s and this
may not be quickly enough to see the "saving"
status, and thus the test will fail.

We should also accept ACTIVE in this test to
make it pass if the above mentioned case happened.

Change-Id: I1f5f58d6d31fd0d1ca05b2de5ca8e72e1ac2a218
Closes-Bug: #1620185
